revised_title: Properties and Solvent Capabilities of Anhydrous Liquefied Ammonia
tldr: The author investigated the solvent properties of anhydrous liquefied ammonia and its chemical reactions with various substances. They found that only a few elementary substances, such as alkali metals, iodine, sulfur, and phosphorus, were soluble in ammonia. Additionally, they observed that salts, particularly those containing mercury, exhibited unique behavior when exposed to the liquid. The study aimed to understand the general solvent properties and chemical reactions of ammonia.
